intro: Gnidia perrieri, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that resemble stars. The plant typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, hard pods that contain seeds. Gnidia perrieri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and public spaces.
